meanings.definition: A symbol in the form of an equal-armed cross with each arm continued at a right angle, used as the emblem of the Nazi party and as an ancient religious symbol.
meanings.sent1: The swastika was a symbol of the Nazi party during World War II.
meanings.sent2: People around the world recognize the swastika as a powerful emblem.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, Sarah wore a fake swastika on her arm for fun.
meanings.sent4: The swastika of hate was burned into the minds of those who witnessed its atrocities.
meanings.sent5: The ancient swastika held deep spiritual significance for many cultures.

meanings.definition: A swastika-shaped figure used as a symbol or ornament in various cultures.
meanings.sent1: The necklace had a small swastika as a decorative element.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, the swastika shape represents good luck.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with a swastika made of frosting for a festive touch.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork featured a swastika motif that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The swastika design was intricately woven into the fabric of the tapestry.
